body_html:
Mm, looks like it may have been a git issue - I think it checked out all the source with dos line endings on my linux box. Nuked the clone, fixed the line endings config and checked out again. It got further this time:

ERROR: /home/nmrp3/devel/oss/tensorflow/tensorflow/core/BUILD:334:1: error while parsing .d file: /home/nmrp3/.cache/bazel/_bazel_nmrp3/af5448b32eaac46105d430d1e2c5b789/tensorflow/bazel-out/local_linux-opt/bin/tensorflow/core/_objs/gpu_kernels/tensorflow/core/kernels/reverse_op_gpu.cu.d (No such file or directory).
In file included from third_party/gpus/cuda/include/cuda_runtime.h:62:0,
                 from <command-line>:0:
third_party/gpus/cuda/include/host_config.h:105:2: error: #error -- unsupported GNU version! gcc 4.10 and up are not supported!
 #error -- unsupported GNU version! gcc 4.10 and up are not supported!

body:
Mm, looks like it may have been a git issue - I think it checked out all the source with dos line endings on my linux box. Nuked the clone, fixed the line endings config and checked out again. It got further this time:

```
ERROR: /home/nmrp3/devel/oss/tensorflow/tensorflow/core/BUILD:334:1: error while parsing .d file: /home/nmrp3/.cache/bazel/_bazel_nmrp3/af5448b32eaac46105d430d1e2c5b789/tensorflow/bazel-out/local_linux-opt/bin/tensorflow/core/_objs/gpu_kernels/tensorflow/core/kernels/reverse_op_gpu.cu.d (No such file or directory).
In file included from third_party/gpus/cuda/include/cuda_runtime.h:62:0,
                 from <command-line>:0:
third_party/gpus/cuda/include/host_config.h:105:2: error: #error -- unsupported GNU version! gcc 4.10 and up are not supported!
 #error -- unsupported GNU version! gcc 4.10 and up are not supported!
```
